lines.content: Duke is a Personal Assistant Chatbot that helps you manage your various tasks.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` installed on your computer.
1. Open a command window in the folder containing the `.jar` file.

1. Run the command `java -jar {filename}.jar`
If you haven't changed the filename, run the command `java -jar iP.jar`
Add tasks to keep track of.
Duke has three subcategories of tasks you may add:
Date & time can be specified for deadline and event tasks. This allows you to have the information ready when needed.
Display all your added tasks as a list.
Mark a task from your list of added tasks as done.
You may delete tasks that you no longer want to manage.
Find all tasks that contain the queried keyword and view them as a list.

All your tasks data is saved in the hard disk automatically, every time you make a change. Once you exit and reload the program, the saved data is loaded. This means you won't lose your data and you can pick up where you left off.
Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
For example, in `todo TASK_DESCRIPTION`, `TASK_DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo wash the dishes`
Adds a Todo task to your task list.
Adds a Deadline task to your task list with a specified due date and time. Date and time must be in the given format.
Adds an Event task to your task list occuring at a specified date and time. Date and time must be in the given format.
Displays all your tasks with their type, completion status, and date & time (for deadlines and events). Tasks are shown as an ordered list.
Mark a task at a specified index, in your task list, as done
Delete a task at a specified index, in your task list.
Finds all tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description. Displays these tasks as an ordered list.
Exits the program with a goodbye message

todo | `todo TASK_DESCRIPTION`
e.g. `todo wash the dishes`

deadline | `deadline TASK_DESCRIPTION /by DDMMYYYY HHMM`
e.g. `deadline finish project /by 02/04/2021 2359`

event | `event TASK_DESCRIPTION /at DDMMYYYY HHMM`
e.g. `event presentation /at 29/05/2021 1000`
* Duke is a command line task manager.
* It allows users to add, delete, save, and complete to-dos, deadlines, and events.
* The code to run the Duke program.
* Takes in user input and executes command's accordingly.
* All commands are subclasses of this abstract Command class.
* This forces all commands to have execute(tasks,ui,storage) and isExit() methods.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* DeadlineCommand is called when user wants to add a new Deadline.
* Constructor method of DeadlineCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for adding a new Deadline.
* Adds new Deadline to the TaskList tasks.
* Prints output confirming addition to user.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* DeleteCommand is called when user wants to delete a task.
* Constructor method of DeleteCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for deleting a task.
* Deletes a task from the TaskList tasks.
* Prints output confirming task deletion to user.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* DoneCommand is called when user wants to mark a task as done.
* Constructor method of DoneCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for marking a task as done.
* Marks a task as done in the TaskList tasks.
* Prints output confirming operation to user.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* EventCommand is called when user wants to add a new Event.
* Constructor method of EventCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for adding a new Event.
* Adds new Event to the TaskList tasks.
* Prints output confirming addition to user.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* ExitCommand is called when user wants to exit the program.
* Constructor method of ExitCommand which sets isExit to true.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* FindCommand is called when user wants to find all tasks whose description contains the queried keyword.
* Constructor method of FindCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for finding tasks with a queried keyword.
* Finds all tasks who description contains queried keyword.
* Prints out matching tasks in an ordered list.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* ListCommand is called when user wants to view all their tasks.
* Prints all tasks stored in TaskList tasks in an ordered list.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* ToDoCommand is called when user wants to add a new ToDo.
* Constructor method of ToDoCommand which stores the user input.
* @param fullCommand String of user input for adding a new ToDo.
* Adds new ToDo to the TaskList tasks.
* Prints output confirming addition to user.
* @param storage Storage to save all tasks, updating the data file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception {
* InvalidCommandException is raised when the user provides an invalid input.
private static final String MESSAGE = "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
* Parser class deals with making sense of the user command.
* parse method takes in a String of user input and returns the corresponding Command object based on it.
* @return Command command object depending on user input.
* @throws InvalidCommandException Thrown when user input is not a valid command.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws InvalidCommandException {
* Storage class is used to load tasks from the data file and save tasks to the data file.
private static final String ROOT_PATH = System.getProperty("user.dir");
private static final Path FOLDER_PATH = Paths.get(ROOT_PATH, "data");
private static final Path FILE_PATH = Paths.get(ROOT_PATH, "data", "duke.txt");
* Constructor method for the Storage class.
* Creates a file directory and data file inside of it unless it already exists.
* @param ui Takes in a Ui object, used to print error messages.
* Loads Task data saved in the data file.
* Task data is converted into an ArrayList<Task>.
* @return ArrayList<TasK> that were saved in the data file.
* Saves all tasks in TaskList to the data file.
* @param tasks TaskList object containing all existing.
* Subclass of Task that is used to represent Deadline tasks created by user
* @param by Date and time (deadline) that the task needs to be completed by.
String byString = by.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy HH:mm"));
* Returns a String that contains all details of the deadline (status, description, and deadline).
* @return String containing all details of the deadline.
* Subclass of Task that is used to represent Event tasks created by user.
* @param at Date and time that the event is at.
String byString = at.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy HH:mm"));
* Returns a String that contains all details of the event (status, description, and date & time).
* @return String containing all details of the event.
* Each instance represents a task created by the user.
* A Task has two fields, a description and a boolean isDone to indicate if it's completed.
* Constructor method for the Task Class.
* Returns a cross if task is done or single space if not done.
* Returns a String that contains all details of the task (status and description).
* @return String containing all details of the task.
* TaskList is a class used to contain the list of all tasks created by the user.
* Constructor method to create a new TaskList with no tasks.
* Constructor method that takes in an ArrayList<Task>.
* Used to load tasks from the data file.
* Takes in a task and adds it to the TaskList.
* Takes in an index and removes the corresponding task from the TaskList.
* @param index Index in the TaskList of the task to remove.
* Returns ordered list of tasks whose description contains the keyword specified.
* @param keyword String obtained from user's query.
* @return String ordered list of tasks containing keyword.
* Returns a String to represent the tasks in TaskList as an ordered list.
* @return String that is an ordered list of tasks.
* Subclass of Task that is used to represent ToDo tasks created by user.
* Returns a String that contains all details of the ToDo (description).
* @return String containing all details of the ToDo.
* The UI class contains methods that deal with the user.
* UI has methods to read user input and also print output.
* Prints the Duke logo and welcomes the user.
System.out.println("\tWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints goodbye message when the user is exiting the program.
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints a horizontal line made of dashes, intending to separate user input and program output.
* Prints out all existing tasks in the TaskList object.
System.out.println("\tHere are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints out tasks matching queried keyword.
* @param listOfTasks String containing all tasks containing the queried keyword.
System.out.println("\tHere are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Returns String of next line of user's input.
* Prints the error message prepended with an error greeting.
* Prints out message to confirm to the user that the task has been marked as done.
* @param index index that the task that was marked as done corresponds to in tasks.
public void printDoneTask(TaskList tasks, int index) {
System.out.println("\tNice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints out message to confirm to the user that the task has been removed/deleted.
* @param t Task object that user has removed.
* @param taskCounter Total number of tasks remaining.
public void printRemoveTask(Task t, int taskCounter) {
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskCounter + " task in the list.");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskCounter + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints out message to confirm to the user that the task has been added.
* @param t Task object that user has added.
* @param taskCounter Total number of tasks after adding new task.
public void printNewTask(Task t, int taskCounter) {
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskCounter + " task in the list.");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskCounter + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints out error message to indicate user has tried to add new task but left description empty.
* @param type Type of task that the user tried to add.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "The description of a " + type + " cannot be empty.");
* Prints out error message to indicate user has tried to query but hasn't provided a keyword.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "The query cannot be empty.");
* Prints out error message to indicate user has specified invalid task number.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "That task number does not exist.");
* Prints out error message to indicate an error while creating a directory for the data file.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "I've encountered an error while creating a directory :-(");
* Prints out error message to indicate an error while creating the data file.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "I've encountered an error while creating a data file :-(");
* Prints out error message to indicate an error while loading data from the data file.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "I've encountered an error loading your data.");
* Prints out error message to indicate an error while saving user's data to the data file.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "I've encountered an error saving your data.");
* Prints out error message to indicate user has specified invalid or wrongly formatted date.
System.out.println("\t" + exceptionGreeting + "I've encountered an error parsing your date.");
System.out.println("\t" + "Please ensure it is in the format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm");
